WeatherUnderground@nightflame.name: Weather Underground
WeatherUnderground@nightflame.description:
A simple Desklet that loads the PWS Sticker for your chosen Weather Underground weather station. It refreshes periodically.

Weather Station ID is configurable by editing the metadata.json file.

clockTow@armandobs14.name: ClockTow
clockTow@armandobs14.description: This is a fork of native clock.

analog-clock@cobinja.de.name: CobiAnalogClock
analog-clock@cobinja.de.description:
This is an analog clock desklet.

Installation

Via cinnamon settings -> desklets -> Get more online

or download from here, extract the zip-file and copy the enclosed folder 'analog-clock@cobinja.de' to '$HOME/.local/share/cinnamon/desklets/'

Note:  Make sure you have the package gir1.2-rsvg-2.0 installed

Settings

Right-click the desklet and you get a menu item 'settings'. It will open a settings dialog, which configures the desklet instance you called it from.

Themes

The desklet's folder contains another folder called 'themes'. You can install your own themes there.

Hint: Use the default theme as an example.

Bugs

If you notice a bug, please report it here: https://github.com/Cobinja/CobiAnalogClock

Changelog

v1.2

  • Resume clock on power resume
  • Better handling of faulty themes
  • Reduce work if seconds hand is not to be shown

v1.1

  • Theming: put body and clockface into 2 separate files

Roadmap

For one of the next versions I'm planning to add an option 'timezone'.

binaryclockdesklet@entelechy.name: Binary Clock
binaryclockdesklet@entelechy.description:
Binary Clock Desklet

Directions on how to read time in binary: http://www.wikihow.com/Read-a-Binary-Clock.  For this clock, the first row is hours; the second row, minutes; and the third row, seconds.

Changelog

Version 1.2: Make color and diameter of the lights configurable via the new settings API; provide option to hide seconds

Version 1.1: Rename uuid to avoid mixing up with the applet; due to upstream changes in cinnamon-git

xkcd@rjanja.name: xkcd comic viewer
xkcd@rjanja.description:
This applet sits on your desktop and will show the latest comic five seconds after loading. Left clicking cycles back through older comics, downloading where necessary. A right-click context menu allows you to jump back to the latest comic, or open the folder where comics are being stored (~/Pictures/xkcd by default, this you can modify by editing metadata.js). Enjoy!

Changelog:

  • 2013-01-30: Added tooltip with alt-text. The positioning is kind of screwy, but it'll have to suffice for now.
  • 2013-01-28: Initial commit

TimeAndDate@nightflame.name: Time and Date Desklet
TimeAndDate@nightflame.description:
This is a simple desklet to display the time and date. The size and format of the date are configurable by changing the values in metadata.json. This can be launched from the Desklet itself by selecting Config from the menu.

Adjust the following paramters in the metadata.json file which is stored in ~/.local/share/cinnamon/desklets/TimeAndDate@nightflame:

    "timeFormat": "%H:%M",
    "timeSize": "50pt",
    "dateFormat": "%A,%e %B",
    "dateSize": "25pt"

** REMEMBER TO LEAVE THE COMMAS IN - except for the last line!**

The time and date format are from JavaScript toLocaleFormat function, and the possible values can be found at:

http://pubs.opengroup.org/onlinepubs/007908799/xsh/strftime.html

For exmple to add seconds change timeFormat to:

    "timeFormat": "%H:%M:%S",
    
** After changing the settings you need to remove and re-add the Desklet **

-Steve

accudesk@logan.name: AccuWeather Desklet
accudesk@logan.description:
Just an accuweather desklet. Hope you like it.

If you live in US for location just enter your zip code (a hint from a few users)
I'm not sure if it works for UK also. You should try.

Otherwise find out your location here

http://thale.accu-weather.com/widget/thale/city-find.asp?location=

and add your location at that link

If you have spaces in your city's names replace them with % 20
If you have special characters then try to replace them with their equivalent

So for Aldeanueva de San Bartolomé you'll have to change é into e . Of couse replace spaces with % 20 (see below)

some examples
http://thale.accu-weather.com/widget/thale/city-find.asp?location=Aldeanueva de San Bartolome

http://thale.accu-weather.com/widget/thale/city-find.asp?location=London

oook this html thingy is a pain :)


refresh time is 10+ min.

You can switch the forcast for day and night by pressing the button left of accuweather text.

You can configure it by right click it in the desklets list and ->configure



P.S.: Keep in mind im not a programer :). Icons are not mine. got them from a forum a while back and i have no idea the address to link it here

CHANGELOG

1.05

  • Data loading changed to asynchronous method to avoid entire desktop freezing while loading data from accuweather. Hope it works!

1.04

  • Added option to turn border on/off and change color to border
  • Added right click->Settings menu option.

1.03

  • Added option to resize it..
  • You don't have to restart it anymore to apply the changes for number of days in forecast.

1.02

  • Some things that i forgot to remove

1.00

  • First release

calculator@scollins.name: Desktop Calculator
calculator@scollins.description:

drivesManager@lestcape.name: Drives Manager
drivesManager@lestcape.description:
A Drives Manager Desklet for Cinnamon - v0.6-Beta. 20 July 2013.
Author: Lester Carballo Pérez mailto:lestcape@gmail.com

This is a desklet to display the current drives plugged to the computer. We can used the ability to show the volumens of the drive, also indicate if the volumen is mounted. When plugged a removable volumen, you can mount and unmount the volumen. If the volumen is mount, you can access directly with left click in to the icon of drive. The configuration for all option it is in schema format, and is accesible for the cinnamon settings, or directly with right click in the desklet.

This program is free software: you can redistribute it and/or modify it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published by the Free Software Foundation, either version 3 of the License, or (at your option) any later version.

This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the GNU General Public License for more details.

You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License along with this program. If not, see http://www.gnu.org/licenses/.

Instalation Instructions:

  1. Download folder drivesManager@lestcape with all file and subfolder from http://github.com/lestcape/Drives-Manager.
  2. Put in /home/USER/.local/share/cinnamon/desklets/ where USER is your account.
  3. Enable a Desklet in Cinnamon Settings and use.


Issues and improvements:

  • Warning! This desklet need gksu package is installed to activate advanced options.The pkexec package cannot be added at this time.
  • hddtemp is too slow to run it directly on the console. This is why it generates a temporary file called datahddtemp, with the output of this command, which will be read when needed.
  • Iconv command is needed in order to automatically update the translation file when this has special characters. View: https://github.com/linuxmint/Cinnamon/issues/2245
  • Advanced Option for Optical devices, need packages "cdrecord" and "wodim" to detect status(open/closed) of the CD/DVD. The command cdrecord depends on wodim, and when the optical drive has a disk, wodim sometimes fail to properly access the device.
  • Optical option, only detect as a CD/DVD drives, the device id match with "dev/sr[0-9]+", "/dev/cdrom[0-9]+", "/dev/cdrom", "/dev/scd[0-9]+", "/dev/hdc". If you have other id for some optical device, please let me know, to update.
  • The Hard drive and optical option need the "coreutils" package, for use the command df.
  • Sometimes auto mount points open devices may fail and open more than once the same volume. This is because the volume was removed using an alternative mode not recognized by the operating system, and when this reconnect may appear doubled.
  • The "use pmount package" option requires package "pmount". The pmount command does not need superuser permissions to process the operation mount and unmount, which is why the operation can not be performed with protocols support operating system. Visit: http://pmount.alioth.debian.org/, for more details on this package.

How to add a new language:

1- Open terminal and write "locale", the output is some things like this:
LANG=es_MX.UTF-8
LANGUAGE=es_MX:es
LC_CTYPE="es_MX.UTF-8"
LC_NUMERIC="es_MX.UTF-8"
LC_TIME="es_MX.UTF-8"
LC_COLLATE="es_MX.UTF-8"
LC_MONETARY="es_MX.UTF-8"
LC_MESSAGES="es_MX.UTF-8"
LC_PAPER="es_MX.UTF-8"
LC_NAME="es_MX.UTF-8"
LC_ADDRESS="es_MX.UTF-8"
LC_TELEPHONE="es_MX.UTF-8"
LC_MEASUREMENT="es_MX.UTF-8"
LC_IDENTIFICATION="es_MX.UTF-8"
LC_ALL=
In this example the first row "LANG=es_MX.UTF-8" is mark that  system language it's in spanish. Look "es" it's the key to determine the language.
2- Go to /home/User/.local/share/cinnamon/desklets/drivesManager@lestcape.
3- In the lang folder make a copy of file "en" and change the name of file copy to the key name was obtained in step 1.
4- Open the copy of file, in the contents of this, exist some lines with a "key=value" format. You can't change the key. You can only change the value, translate the present value in english language to your language.
5- Save your file.
6- Close the desklet and the system settings, if it's open.
7- Delete the file settings-schema.json in folder  /home/User/.local/share/cinnamon/desklets/drivesManager@lestcape. Please take warning, don't delete the file skeleton-settings-schema.json or some another one.
8- Open the desklet, it's now in your language.
9- Please send your file by email lestcape@gmail.com. It's will be putting in the official web page of cinnamon, with your nick name or name depending on your preference.

Warning! Cinnamon has a bug in the handling of special characters, such as accents or ñ. This is only for users who do not use the english language. All translation files need to be in UTF-8 encoding. Different encodings to UTF-8 are not admitted, even are compatible with UTF-8. You can help that the problem is quickly solved, participating in the discussion of the following url: https://github.com/linuxmint/Cinnamon/issues/2245

ChangeLog:

  • 0.6-Beta
  1. Added the hddtemp tool to measure the temperature of hard disks.
  • 0.5-Beta
  1. The automatic installation of pmount was fixed.
  2. Added support for languages. The file settings-schema.json was eliminated, it will be generated automatically based on the language of the system, from the new file included "skeleton-settings-schema.json". Also was included the new file "translate.js" for translation automation.
  3. Added Spanish language.
  • 0.4-Beta
  1. The code was optimized to use less CPU.
  2. Was added a new option. Now you can choose not to spend CPU and have the information capacity of the current mounted volumes.
  • 0.3-Beta
  1. Now you can open mount point with space.
  2. Fixed problem to open the mount point of volumen.
  • 0.2-Beta
  1. Fixed problem with the reconnection of electrified devices.
  2. Add suport for recognized Drives with more than one volume
  3. The option "Safely Remove" changed its name to "use pmount package".
  4. Now you can reconnect the removable devices without removing them from its connector.  
  • 0.1-Beta
  1. Initial release


Report issues:
http://github.com/lestcape/Drives-Manager/issues

Requests:
http://github.com/lestcape/Drives-Manager/pulls

If you want to help develop the desklet, language support, or icon pack, contact me without any problem.
Thanks.

Lester.

soundBox@scollins.name: Soundbox
soundBox@scollins.description:
This is a Desklet heavily based upon the Cinnamon sound applet. A few key differences include:

  • Sits on the Desktop for easier viewing and access
  • Altered layout for more consistency of design
  • Clicking the volume icon toggles mute
  • Clicking the time text toggles between elapsed/remaining time
  • Proprietary theme system
  • Option to show volume controls for each application
  • Option to set max volume above 100% (as is system default)

I currently have 3 themes defined, but hope to have many more in the future. Any help in that regard would be very welcome, as I am not very good with themes myself.

If you are interested in contributing, feel free to join me on github.

I have also created a guide to creating themes for Soundbox.

 

Changelog:

1.5 (10 Oct 2013)

  • Updates for Cinnamon 2.0
  • Various theme updates including:
    • 2 new themes (ghost and ice)
    • Popups and tooltips are now themed
    • Various tweaks to existing themes
  • Various bugfixes and tweaks

1.4 (22 Aug 2013)

  • More slider fixes
  • Application volume display fixes
  • Theme updates

1.3 (13 Aug 2013)

  • Fixed slider drag problem

1.2 (7 Aug 2013)

  • More Layout Tweaks
  • Added option to use cinnamon themes (must be supported by the theme)

1.1 (6 Aug 2013)

  • Added application volume controls (available via settings)
  • Added option to exceed 100% volume (as is possible in sound settings)
  • Various layout tweaks
  • Added sound settings to context menu

1.0 (1 Aug 2013)

  • Initial release

jalalidesklet@30yavash.com.name: Jalali Time and Date Desklet
jalalidesklet@30yavash.com.description:
Jalali Time And Date - Cinnamon Desklet
 
The Iranian calendars are a succession of calendars invented or used for over two millennia in Iran (Persia). One of the longest chronological records in human history, the Iranian calendar has been modified time and again during its history to suit administrative, climatic, and religious purposes.
The modern Iranian calendar (Solar Hijri calendar (SH)) is now the official calendar in Iran and Afghanistan. It begins on the vernal equinox as determined by astronomical calculations for the Iran Standard Time meridian (52.5°E or GMT+3.5h). This determination of starting moment is more accurate than the Gregorian calendar as far as predicting the date of the vernal equinox is concerned because it uses astronomical calculation rather than mathematical rules. but requires consulting an astronomical almanac.
 

CHANGELOG

0.4 (29 Sep 2013)

  • use farsi numbers

0.3 (29 Sep 2013)

  • fix warnings

0.2(27 Sep 2013)

  • chane class name

0.1

  • initial Release
 
-Siavash Salemi

netusage@30yavash.com.name: Network usage monitor
netusage@30yavash.com.description:
The desklet is based on Network usage monitor applet from clem.

How it does it:

The vnstat daemon runs in the background and collects info about your Internet usage.

The applet detect which device you're currently using, and simply export a graph using vnstati.

What you need for it to work:

You need:

  • To install vnstat
  • To install vnstati
  • To have the vnstat daemon running

Note: In Linux Mint, you can simply run "apt install vnstati" and that will take care of everything. In other distributions it might depend on the way things are packaged but it's likely to be similar.

-Siavash Salemi

quoteOfTheDay@tinnu.name: Quote of the Day
quoteOfTheDay@tinnu.description:
This desklet displays a random quote of the day from a user defined input file.  By default, quotes from the 'fortune' program are displayed.  The readme explains how to format your own input file, if you choose to do so.

Feedback appreciated!

devTools@scollins.name: Cinnamon Developer's Tools
devTools@scollins.description:
This is a desklet that I put together some time ago as I felt that Looking Glass was too clunky for me, and I wanted quick access to certain other features (such as restarting Cinnamon). While it is more useful on a dual-monitor setup, even when I'm using only a single screen I find it invaulable. I finally got around to cleaning up the codebase and posting it here so that other developers working 'under the hood' with applets, desklets, and Cinnamon itself could enjoy this tool as well.

This is not a polished desklet, so expect that there will be bugs, and things that don't work well, as well as missing features, etc. If you decide to make some fixes or add features, please upload them to https://github.com/collinss/Cinnamon-Developer-Tools so that others can enjoy them as well.

 

Features:

  • Shows output of the Cinnamon error log (from Looking Glass)
  • Gives access to all loaded applets, desklets and extensions, with the ability to reload them
  • Has quick-access buttons for restarting Cinnamon, accessing settings, and launching Looking Glass (this last can be configured to use the Cinnamon version, or Melange)
  • The whole interface can be collapsed with a single click

 

Changelog:

1.0 (9 Oct 2013)

  • Initial release
